title: Ivan Yanzhul
text: Ivan Ivanovich Yanzhul (Иван Иванович Янжул; 1846–1914) was a professor of <a href="financial%20law">financial law</a> at <a href="Moscow%20University">Moscow University</a> who established the Russian state <a href="factory%20inspection">factory inspection</a>. He helped enforce the <a href="Labour%20law%20in%20the%20Russian%20Empire">first Russian labour code</a> (1 June 1882) which provided a measure of protection for Russian factory workers. His job involved finding an industrial enterprise, gaining access to the premises and forcing the owner to halt illegal practices such as night <a href="child%20labor">child labor</a>. His political views have been described as <a href="state%20socialism">state socialism</a> in that he advocated that government manipulation of tax and customs policy was sufficient for the realisation of socialism. Yanzhul was elected into the <a href="Russian%20Academy%20of%20Sciences">Russian Academy of Sciences</a> in 1895. His <a href="memoirs">memoirs</a> were published in 2 volumes in 1910 and 1911.
